PICKRELL--Eugene R.,Age 55. Born April 7,1960 to Robert Pickrell and Barbra Favale passed into the arms of his Heavenly Father early Saturday morning July 18, 2015 at home with his loving wife by his side in Orlando, FL. Gene is survived by his father, his two sisters Mary Jo and Jacque and his wife Heather. Gene loved to travel and lived in many places: Connecticut, Vermont, New Hampshire, New York, Massachusetts, Arizona and Florida the last seven years he lived in Orlando, FL. A celebration of life will be held in Orlando, FL at the County Line Moose Lodge 2427 where Gene was a Legionnaire on Sunday, August 23, 2015 at 1:00pm. A donation account has been set up in his name at Wells Fargo "Eugene Pickrell donations". Gene will be missed by many and his memory will live on. 1/3

STERN--Vera. All of us at The New School's New York String Orchestra Seminar join the family, friends, and thousands of young musicians who were touched by the generosity and indomitable spirit of Vera Stern in celebrating her life and all she gave to so many of us. 1/3
GARNICK--Beatrice (Bea). Born on this day, July 29th in 1924. Would be 91 years young today. Beloved Mom, Grandma and Wife. We miss you everyday! Love, Ross, Laura, Jonah, Vicki and Ash. 1/3
CROHN--Frank. The trustees of the Burrill B. Crohn Research Foundation remember with pride and affection our late treasurer and first president, Frank Crohn of Rhinebeck, NY. He will be missed. 1/3

OPPENHEIM--Elaine Kent, died peacefully in her home on July 27, 2015. She was 96. From her early career as a radio actress to her final role as great-grandmother, her life was characterized by enthusiasm, determination, and unquestioned loyalty to the people she loved. No one read the New York Times more carefully or played Scrabble more ferociously. A proud New Yorker for ten decades; gracious, elegant, funny and a wonderful listener. She was happiest as loving wife to Charles, mother to Barbara and Jan, grandmother to Lee, Ashley, and Christopher, and great-grand- mother to Jack and Beatrice. In lieu of flowers, contributions in her name can be made to the Parkinson's Disease Foundation or The American Cancer Society. 1/3

SEIDLER--Ann Ganong, died peacefully at her home in Northampton on July 24th, surrounded by her family. Born in Northampton on September 8th, 1925, she graduated from Smith College as a Theatre Major in 1946 and taught theater in Honolulu. Professionally, Dr. Seidler (Ph.D., New York University), was a speech therapist and author of many children's books as well a Professor of Speech and Theatre at Montclair State University in New Jersey. She was a member of the Author's Guild, the Metropolitan Opera Club, and was active in the Institute for Retired Professionals at the New School. She resided in Manhattan. Ann is survived by her four children, Dr. Jan Seidler Ramirez, Karen Seidler Gross (Robert), Bayard Seidler, and Dr. Christopher Seidler (Cheryl Hersperger), nine grandchildren and a great-granddaughter. She was predeceased by her husband William Dickson Seidler. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made in her memory to the Montclair State University Foundation, Speech /Theatre Scholarship, 1 Normal Avenue, Montclair, NJ 07043, or the Botanic Gardens of Smith College, 16 College Lane, Northampton, MA 01063. 1/3

PERTZ--Stuart K.,architect, planner, educator--a man of unlimited interests and talents, dedicated to betterment of life for others and enjoyment of his own. Stuart was a great friend, inspiration, and collaborator, a lively stream of ideas and good cheer, effervescent, constructive, positive, enthusiastic and full of life. He was an invaluable officer and trustee of the City Club of New York, and key to its recent revitalization. We will greatly and gratefully miss him. The City Club of New York 1/3

SLOANE--Carl S. Carl S. Sloane, the Ernest L. Arbuckle Professor of Business Administration, Emeritus, Harvard Business School, passed away on July 28, 2015 after a brief illness. He was the son of George and Dorothy Sloane, was born in Brooklyn, New York on February 9, 1937. He leaves his beloved wife of 56 years, Toby M. Sloane (nee Tattlebaum), his children Lisa, Amy, and Todd, and their spouses Robert, Nicolas, and Lili, his five cherished grandchildren Alexandra, Charles, Olivia, Sally, and Ian, and his brothers Richard and Stephen Sloane. He resided in Highland Beach, Florida. After graduating from Far Rockaway High School in 1954, he attended Harvard University, Class of 1958 and Harvard Business School, graduating with honors in 1960. In a career spanning nearly fifty years, Professor Sloane spent thirty years in management consulting, the last twenty with the firm he co-founded, Temple, Barker & Sloane, and its successor firm, Mercer Management Consulting, where he served as Chairman and CEO. He also served as Co-Chairman of Alix Partners/Questor Holdings, and as Chairman of Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center. In addition to consulting, he served on the Boards of Andell, Ltd., American President Companies, The Brinks Company, Ionics, Leaseway Transportation, MedSource Technologies, Moore McCormack, Rayonier and Sapient. At Harvard Business School, his principal focus was on leadership of organizations undergoing significant, transformational change. Through a lifetime engagement to entrepreneurship, teaching and philanthropy his charismatic, thoughtful vision for leadership has been shared with many who will carry it forth as his legacy. His lifelong philanthropic engagement included service on the boards of Boston's Combined Jewish Philanthropies, Harvard Medical Faculty Physicians at BIDMC, the Cardio Vascular Institute at BIDMC, the Jewish Federation of the North Shore, the Jewish Community Center of Marblehead, and the Harvard Hillel Foundation. He and Toby were also active supporters of Congregation Shirat Hayam, Birthright Israel, AIPAC, and Friends of the IDF. Deeply caring, generous, and passionately engaged in his family and the communities he was part of, he touched the lives of many by whom he'll be remembered. Services at Congregation Shirat Hayam, 55 Atlantic Avenue, Swampscott on Wednesday (today), July 29, 2015 at 1:00 pm. Interment at Congregation Shirat Hayam Cemetery, Temple Israel Section, Peabody. Memorial observance Wednesday evening and Thursday evening at his late residence. In lieu of flowers, expressions of sympathy may be made to Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center, c/o Chris Laping, 330 Brookline Avenue, Boston, MA 02215. Services by Stanetsky-Hymanson Memorial Chapel, Salem. For online condolences, please visit www.stanetskyhymanson salem.com. 1/3

DANFORTH--Theodore, Passed away July 26, 2015 of a heart attack in Southampton, NY. He is survived by his loving wife of 40 years Laura, and his five children Theodore Danforth Jr., Alexandra Danforth, Bryan Danforth, Laura Danforth, and Florence Danforth-Meyer; and two grandchildren Isabelle and Nicholas. He was born in Boston, Massachusetts to William H. Danforth and Hilma L. Nelson. He graduated from The Hill School, Amherst College, and attended Harvard Business School. He served on the boards of the J. Craig Venter Institute, North Shore LIJ-- North Shore University Hospital, Manhasset, NY; Jupiter Island Medical Center in Jupiter, FL; and the Library Museum of the U.S. Golf Association. He served as trustee of the Village of Matinecock from 1970-1995. He was a member of St. Andrews Royal and Ancient, Augusta National Golf Club, Piping Rock Club, Jupiter Island Club, Medalist Golf Club, The Meadow Club, Racquet Club of New York, Seminole Golf Club, Shinnecock Hills Golf Club, Somerset Club, The Southampton Bathing Corporation, The Southampton Club. The service will be held at the St. Andrew's Dune Church on Gin Lane in Southampton, NY at 4pm on Friday, August 7th. Please honor his memory with an act of kindness. 1/3

COLM--Howard, on July 28, 2015 of Haddonfield, NJ and Wilmington, DE. Beloved husband of Maxine Rosalind. Devoted father of Stephen (Beverly) and Mark (Amy). Loving grandfather of Clancey, Bowen, Austin and Trevor. Dear brother of Bernard Cohn. Services Thursday, July 30, 1pm at the Mount Hebron Cemetery, 130-04 Horace Harding Expressway, Flushing, NY. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to Cornell University School of Mechanical Engineering. 1/3
DORFMAN--Deborah, resident of Matteson Road passed away peacefully at her home on Friday, July 17, 2015. 1/3

CROHN--Frank T. Died at home on July 26, 2015 at the age of 91. Beloved husband of Helene, devoted father of Frank Crohn, Jr., Carole Davis, Alex Crohn, Adrienne Crohn, Laurie Jannelli and David Crohn. He is also survived by ten grandchildren and eleven great grandchildren. In addition to the pride and pleasure he took in his family, he spent decades in the business world. Frank founded and built two insurance companies, served on the boards of several financial institutions and insurance companies as well as philanthropic organizations. He affected the lives of everyone who knew him and will be missed and remembered with affection and admiration. Funeral to be held at Temple Emanuel of Kingston, NY on July 29, 2015 at 10:30 AM. In lieu of flowers, the family asks that donations be made to waynebartonstudycenter.org or to templeemanuelkingston.org. 1/3

MONTROSS--Joan Oliver. August 21, 1930-July 25, 2015. Joan Montross died peacefully Saturday afternoon, July 25th, after a long struggle with Parkinson's, surrounded by her family at Meadow Ridge in Redding, Connecticut. Joan grew up in Wellesley, Massachusetts and graduated from Duke University where she was elected Phi/Beta Kappa. She had a successful decorating business in Bedford, New York for many years and was also a consultant with Carlisle. She was president of the Bedford Garden Club, Chairman of St. Matthew's Church flower committee and Chairman of the House committee and Board Member at John Jay Homestead. She was also Chairman of the Parent's Council at Rippowan School. She loved literature, gardening, cooking and her family. She leaves two children; Franklin Montross IV and Lee Wheeler-Shanker and six grandchildren; Whit, Scott and Nina Montross and Perrin, Oliver and Emma Wheeler. A memorial service is planned for 11:00am September 8th at St. Matthew's Church in Bedford, New York. In lieu of flowers please send donations to the Michael J. Fox foundation, www.michaeljfox.org/tribute/ 1/3
ZANKEL--Arthur. I can't believe it's ten years. In my heart and my thoughts every day. Love always, Judy 1/3

CECIL--Jane. The Board and staff of the Center for Educational Innovation extends its deepest sympathies to our dear Board member, Donald Cecil and family at the passing of his extraordinary wife, Jane. She was a woman of great compassion and valor who enriched the lives of all who knew her; especially the lives of the children who benefited from her generosity and wisdom. Center for Educational Innovation Judy Berkowitz, Chairman Sy Fliegel, President 1/3

CROHN--Frank T.,passed away July 26, 2015. He leaves an indelible and long lasting legacy as a loving husband and father, master of language and emotion, business impresario and ultimate friend. His many associates and admirers at Unity Life and Columbian Life mourn his passing and will miss his wisdom, compassion and energy. 1/3

SPIELMAN--Arthur. The City College of New York mourns the passing of Arthur Spielman, professor of psychology at City College and the CUNY Graduate Center. Spielman graduated from CCNY in 1970 and received his Ph.D. from the CUNY Graduate Center in 1979. He joined the CCNY faculty in 1981, becoming a full professor in 1990. A pioneer in sleep research, he recently received the Sleep Research Society's Outstanding Scientific Achievement Award. At the time of his death, he was working on a book on the treatment of insomnia. On behalf of our students, faculty and staff, we extend sincerest condolences to the Spielman family. Lisa S. Coico, President 1/3

CECIL--Jane Grossman, Died July 25 following a short illness. Loving wife and devoted partner to Donald Cecil, her surviving husband of 62 years. Beloved mother of Leslie (Creighton Michael) and Alec (Diane Zultowsky), and grandmother to Balin, Jake, Eli and Loren. She was the only child of Alexander Grossman and Helen Tuck Grossman. Jane attended Scarsdale High School and was a graduate and active alumna of Smith College. Known for her intelligence, elegance and being the consummate hostess, she enjoyed a full life and traveled the world with her husband and family. A lifelong resident of Westchester County, she devoted herself to supporting many local organizations and programs, particularly those focusing on education for children from families with limited means and opportunity. She was a leader in philanthropy and served on boards for a number of non- profits, including Student Advocacy, the White Plains YWCA and Todays Students, Tomorrows Teachers. She and Donald shepherded an I Have a Dream program in Mt. Vernon in the 1980s and established the Jandon Scholars Program in 1999, which has, to date, assisted over 200 students from the county in attending college. They have also been active supporters of Purchase College, including establishing the Writing through the Arts program. Her personal involvement, wisdom and leadership were so valued by many who sought her advice and assistance, and she was honored by multiple organizations over the years. The family will have a private interment. A memorial service will be held at a later date. The family will receive visitors from 5 to 9 p.m. on Tuesday (July 28) and Thursday (July 30) at the home of Alec Cecil, Pelham, NY, and on Wednesday (July29 ) at the home of Leslie Cecil, Mt. Kisco, NY. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to Student Advocacy, 3 West Main Street, Suite 212, Elmsford, NY 10523 or to the charity of your choice. 1/3

WERNER--Vera Stein, 92, died peacefully at home Friday, July 24th. Predeceased by her loving husband Jack, Vera is survived by her children Ken (Noreen), Karen (Ken), Andrea (Brad), and grandchildren. Funeral services at Larchmont Temple, 75 Larchmont Ave, Larchmont, NY, Thursday, July 30th, 11am. Family and friends invited to gather at the family home. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to Nazi Victim Services Program of Self Help Community Services, Inc., 520 8th Ave, NY, NY 10018. 1/3

WEINBERGER--Gerald J.,passed away on July 26, 2015 at the age of 72 years old. He is survived by his beloved wife of almost 50 years, Irene, devoted sons Greg with Diane and Jeff with Patti; adoring grandchildren Jack David, Alex Simon, Nick Damon, Brian Scott and Katie Elizabeth and loving sister Susan with Michael Stein. Donations may be made to the American Diabetes Association in his memory. 1/3
DeFINA--Frank. The Officers, Governors and Members of the Friars Club deeply mourn the loss of their esteemed Member. We extend our heartfelt sympathy to his family. 1/3

MORRONE--Joe (90), passed away July 28, 2015. Survived by wife, Ruth, her son, Vincent, daughter, Dr Lee Ellen Morrone, grandchildren, Allegra and Joey Fierro, and sister, Rose Montagnino. Distinguished WW2 Veteran awarded Bronze Medal for Bravery and Purple Heart, retired advertising creative director and a world traveller, he will be remembered most for his clever witticisms, trivia expertise and "Morrone Minutes." Visitation July 29 Andrett Funeral Home, 212- 475-2024, Funeral Mass 10am July 30 St Jean Baptiste Church Memorial contributions to St. Jude 1/3

PISAR--Samuel. We mourn the loss of Samuel Pisar, a dear friend and colleague, whose courageous, big-hearted life enriched us in innumerable ways. We send condolences to his wife, Judith, and his entire beautiful family. Jamie Bernstein, Alexander Bernstein, Nina Bernstein Simmons and The Leonard Bernstein Office. 1/3

SILVERSTEIN--Jeffrey H.,M.D. The Department of Anesthesiology at the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai mourns the passing of Jeffrey H. Silverstein, M.D. an esteemed anesthesiologist, researcher, educator, colleague and friend who enriched the professional careers of students, house staff and faculty alike. His accomplishments in the study of postoperative cognitive dysfunction, research mentorship and the protection of human subjects are foundational. His colleagues and friends in Anesthesiology will miss his warmth and wit and extend heartfelt sympathies to his wife and colleague, Dr. Stacie Deiner and his family. 1/3

LANGER--JoAnn, of the Upper West Side of Manhattan, passed away on July 27, 2015 at the age of 65, after a long and brave battle with cancer. A life long New Yorker, JoAnn was born in Ozone Park, Queens, New York. Her lifelong passion of women's fashion guided a long and highly successful career as an apparel merchant. Her first job in the industry, not far from her childhood neighborhood, was at Gertz department store in Jamaica Queens, NY. Following that, JoAnn took on executive roles at numerous industry-leading businesses, including Stix Baer & Fuller, Macy's, Bloomingdales, Tahari, Anne Klein, Susan Bristol, GM Design Group, Alvin Valley, leading to her role at TJX Canada in 2008 where she worked till recently. JoAnn's most recent post at TJX was Senior Vice President Merchandising Director. JoAnn guided merchants and buyers for the Canadian Winners store chain. Throughout her career, JoAnn demonstrated a wonderful talent for forging strong partnerships with vendors and for fostering a stimulating, positive and rewarding environment for her employees. Her husband Joe Powers predeceases JoAnn. She is survived by her sister Elaine, niece Jennifer Carpentieri, Jennifer's husband Billy and Jennifer's daughter Alysa. A wake will be held Wednesday, July 29th from 2-5pm and 7-9pm, at the Charles O'Shea Funeral Home: 603 Wantagh Ave. (Exit 28N SS PKWY) Wantagh Long Island 11793 Tel. #

MASTELLONE--Florence Rasero, age 95, died July 25, 2015. Born to Rosa Giaretti and Joseph Rasero. Married to Dr. George Mastellone. A brilliant woman, a devoted wife and mother, an amazing cook. Survived by children Flavia Mastellone, New Ashford, MA; George Mastellone, Arlington, MA; grandchildren Nick, Emily, Michela; great- grandchild, Rosa. Funeral service at St. John Cemetery, Middle Village, July 30,1pm. 1/3

JOHNSON--Mary P.,(formerly known as Mary Donovan), 59, of New York City and Asbury Park, NJ, July 1 after a brave battle with cancer. She was previously a longtime resident of Ringwood, NJ. Until last August, Ms. Johnson was Assistant Professor of Clinical Nursing and Program Director of the Acute Care Nurse Practitioner Program at Columbia University School of Nursing, where she also earned her Doctorate in Nursing Practice. A nurse for 30 years, she was named a Fulbright Specialist in 2012, and wrote extensively on acute care, transplantation and simulation training. She is survived by her husband Rande Johnson; sons Matthew Donovan of Denver, CO and Eric (Marisa) Donovan and grandsons Brady, Beau and Caleb, all of Hinsdale, Illinois, stepdaughter Roxanne of Denver, CO and a large extended family. Services are private. In her memory, please consider a donation to the Children's Organ Transplant Association: http://cota.org/give/ and/or register as an organ donor: http://donatelife.net/ register-now 1/3

WEST--Bernard. The Board of Directors and the members of Quaker Ridge Golf Club are saddened by the passing of our beloved friend and esteemed member of more than 44 years, Bernard West. We extend our heartfelt sympathy to his wife Joyce and the entire family in their time of sorrow. Marc Friedman, President 1/3

COTLOWITZ--Gisela, passed on July 23, 2015 at the age of 85 in North Hills, NY. She is survived by her sister, sons, granddaughter and numerous friends. Gisela was born in Europe, raised and educated in Asia, and continued her life in America. She will always be in our hearts. 1/3

FARLEY--Philip W.,95 years old, died on July 25, 2015 after a long infirmity. He was the father of Augusta Farley, Joan Farley Gillispie and her husband Mark, and Anne (Schatzie) Farley and her husband Ed Moore. Phil was married for 48 happy years to the former Phyllis Rothschild (or "Bubbles," as he liked to call her) and was a patient and mostly amused stepfather to her sons Kito, Frederick, Alexander, and Elliot Peters. He was also the beloved Gampy (or Grandphilip) of 12 and enthusiastic great-grandfather of eight. Phil was extremely handsome, a graduate of Buckley, Choate and Yale, a war hero in the South Pacific, an avid fisherman, a steady consumer of low-tar cigarettes, Scotch, and vodka, and an incorrigible flirt with a sly and wicked sense of humor. The world will be a less entertaining place without him in it. 1/3

WEST--Bernard. We miss our dear friend, Bernard West. A man of exceptional intellect, great love for his family and beloved by his friends. Our love to Joyce and their wonderful family. Arnold & Marjorie Goldbaum 1/3

PHILLIPS--Suzanne R.,died tragically July 27 in an accident. Daughter of the late Estelle and Melvin Phillips, Woodmere, LI. Survived by her children Raleigh and Morgan Mark, her brother Todd Phillips and his family, her loving partner Robert Leedom, and husband Steve Mark. Suzanne was a talented entertainment attorney who was especially proud to work on "Miss Piggy" and "The Muppets" for highly successful puppeteer clients. Her beauty, style, warmth and wisdom will be greatly missed. Services will be held this Friday, July 31, 9:30am, Plaza Jewish Community Chapel, 630 Amsterdam at West 91st Street, New York. 1/3
OLSON--Martha A. 12/25/1920 - 7/30/2011 Gracious, giving, glorious -- our forever Marf. Living with us as long as we are. Thank you, Thank you. Jody et al 1/3

PISAR--Samuel. We mourn the loss of Samuel Pisar, a dear friend and colleague, whose courageous, big-hearted life enriched us in innumerable ways. We send condolences to his wife, Judith, and his entire beautiful family. Jamie Bernstein, Alexander Bernstein, Nina Bernstein Simmons and The Leonard Bernstein Office. 1/3

DeFINA--Frank. The officers and directors of the Friars Foundation deeply mourn the loss of their esteemed member Friar Frank DeFina. He was fierce in his dedication to excellence and continued support of humanitarian causes. He will be sorely missed and we extend our heartfelt sympathy to his family. Ambassador Joseph Zappala, Chairman of the Board 1/3

MILLS--Aurelia DeFelice, passed away July 27 in Englewood, NJ, after a long illness. Born in Brooklyn, NY, she attended Northwestern University before she met Harold, to whom she remained married for 50 years. She was a beloved mother to her three children Penny, Sandy and Lanny, a wonderful grandmother to her four grandchildren, a warm, much- appreciated mother-in-law to Angela and Lin, and a beloved friend to Ken Main. She was an intrepid and committed actress, working in television, motion pictures and the theatre for several decades, and was a member of Actors Equity, the Screen Actors Guild and AFTRA. She will be greatly missed by her family and friends. 1/3

MELNICK--Noah Penzel, born October 10, 1979, passed away July 26, 2015. A graduate of North Shore High School and NYU, Noah attended New York Law School, graduating first in his class. For the past ten years he served as an attorney in the New York offices of Linklaters LLP. A caring and wonderful human being, Noah is survived by his mother, Victoria Penzel, his father and stepfather, Edward Melnick and Barry Grayson, his brother and sister-in-law Scott and Lisa McInnes and his cherished niece Kristin; as well as many aunts, uncles, cousins and friends. Donations in Noah's memory may be made to either the Noah Melnick Memorial Scholarship Fund, c/o The North Shore Central School District, 112 Franklin Avenue, Sea Cliff, NY 11579 or the Noah Melnick Memorial Scholarship Fund, c/o Hewlett Woodmere Public Schools, One Johnson Place, Woodmere, NY 11598. Noah will be remembered for his quick wit, sense of integrity, and belief in always doing what is right. 1/3

SILVERSTEIN--Jeffrey H.,M.D. The Department of Anesthesiology at the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai mourns the passing of Jeffrey H. Silverstein, M.D. an esteemed anesthesiologist, researcher, educator, colleague and friend who enriched the professional careers of students, house staff and faculty alike. His accomplishments in the study of postoperative cognitive dysfunction, research mentorship and the protection of human subjects are foundational. His colleagues and friends in Anesthesiology will miss his warmth and wit and extend heartfelt sympathies to his wife and colleague, Dr. Stacie Deiner and his family. 1/3
WEBER--Arnold, on July 28, 2015. Beloved father of Jonathan and Nicole. Loving brother of Miriam Salmanson and Naomi Wolf. Services private. 1/3

DANFORTH--Theodore, Passed away July 26, 2015 of a heart attack in Southampton, NY. He is survived by his loving wife of 40 years Laura, and his five children Theodore Danforth Jr., Alexandra Danforth, Bryan Danforth, Laura Danforth, and Florence Danforth-Meyer; and two grandchildren Isabelle and Nicholas. He was born in Boston, Massachusetts to William H. Danforth and Hilma L. Nelson. He graduated from The Hill School, Amherst College, and attended Harvard Business School. He served on the boards of the J. Craig Venter Institute, North Shore LIJ-- North Shore University Hospital, Manhasset, NY; Jupiter Island Medical Center in Jupiter, FL; and the Library Museum of the U.S. Golf Association. He served as trustee of the Village of Matinecock from 1970-1995. He was a member of St. Andrews Royal and Ancient, Augusta National Golf Club, Piping Rock Club, Jupiter Island Club, Medalist Golf Club, The Meadow Club, Racquet Club of New York, Seminole Golf Club, Shinnecock Hills Golf Club, Somerset Club, The Southampton Bathing Corporation, The Southampton Club. The service will be held at the St. Andrew's Dune Church on Gin Lane in Southampton, NY at 4pm on Friday, August 7th. Please honor his memory with an act of kindness. 1/3

DREYER--Constance, died on Sunday, July 26 at NYU Langone Medical Center, age 74. Beloved wife and life partner of Dr. Benard Dreyer. Born August 3, 1940 in Broadalbin, NY, Constance was a long-term resident of New York who thrived on the pulse of the city. She was a brilliant hospital administrator whose last position was as Associate Executive for Bellevue Hospital, in charge of clinical services. She retired upon the birth of her last child. Constance and Benard were an inseparable team. She had a phenomenal intellect coupled with strong moral values. She had an indomitable spirit that lifted up all the people she touched. She was an extraordinarily loving person who gave of herself to so many, changing their lives for the better, even during her illness over the past six months. In addition to her husband, she is survived by her children Derek, Dimitra, and Craig and grandchildren, Adeline and Alma. Devoted and selfless, Constance shaped her children's lives in extraordinary ways. A memorial service will be planned in the future. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made in Constance's memory to Children of Bellevue, KiDS of NYU Langone, The American Academy of Pediatrics Friends of Children or the Academic Pediatric Association Fund. 1/3

SMITH--Dennis. We mourn with the rest of the NYU Wagner community and University community the sad loss of our esteemed friend and colleague, Dennis C. Smith. A member of the faculty since 1973, Dennis educated generations of public service leaders. He was a global ambassador for the school, forging partnerships in Belgium, Korea, Italy, Hong Kong, and Spain, among other locations. Throughout his career, Dennis was a leading scholar of criminal justice and worked closely with New York City police commissioners. His pioneering research on CompStat has influenced public policy in New York City and across the country. Dennis was beloved by students; he maintained strong ties with them long after they left his classroom. He will be missed by students, faculty, alumni, staff, and colleagues around the world. We send our heartfelt condolences to his wife, Diane, two daughters, and other members of Dennis' family. 1/3

PRIBYL--Richard Edward, 68, of Millstone Township, NJ on July 29, 2015. Husband of Margaret (nee Whalen) Pribyl. Father of Jeffrey (Sarah) Pribyl. Grandfather of Charles and Alexander Pribyl. Funeral, Friday 8:30am, Rezem Funeral Home, 457 Cranbury Road, East Brunswick. 9:30am Funeral Mass, St. Bartholomew Church, East Brunswick. Interment, Old Tennent Cemetery, Manalapan. Visitation, Thursday 4-8pm at funeral home. Memorials to Weill Cornell Medical College Genitourinary Oncology Research Fund c/o Dr. Himisha Beltran, 525 East 68th St., Box 403, New York, NY 10021. Online condolences to family at www.rezemfh.com. 1/3
WITENKO--Barbara. Girlfriend, miss you like crazy, happy birthday. Love, Diana 1/3
PLATT--Henry B.,of Palm Beach, FL and New York City on July 22nd, 2015, age 91. Service and burial are private. Memorial service will follow at a later date. 1/3

WEST--Bernard. November 16, 1931 - July 28, 2015. It is with great sadness that we mourn the passing of an amazing man. Bernard, beloved husband of Joyce Loewenthal West, adoring father of Jane West and Stacy West Clark, grandfather to Sara Lindsay Clark, Molly Addison Clark and Benjamin Luka Schmitt-West, passed away suddenly on Tuesday, July 28. He was a man of immeasurable generosity who doted on his family and friends with joy, love, birthday cards, gifts, visits and his time. Born in New York City to Lillian West and Milton West, Bernard was a brilliant thinker who adored reading books, watching classic movies from the 1930s and 1940s, skiing, golf and most of all his treasured NYC where he resided for over 50 years. A lover of all things NYC and Colorado and his wonderful house in Westchester, he loved and was a regular at the Ballet, NYC Philharmonic, Metropolitan Opera, the NYC theatre scene and events in Beaver Creek CO. He was a member of Quaker Ridge Golf Club, The University Club, The Harmonie Club, The Cornell Club and The Beaver Creek Club. One of his greatest loves was Cornell University from which he obtained his undergraduate (1955) and law degrees (1955) and volunteered for numerous alumni activities over the years. A second love was American History. He was a brainiac about the Civil War and World War II and his second calling was to be a history teacher. He was a Second Lieutenant in the United States Air Force and was deliriously happy whenever he was in a plane or flying one. Another of his loves was driving and he was darn great at it at 83! He grew up in Rockville Centre, NY and graduated from Cheshire Academy in 1949. In his professional life, he practiced real estate law for a number of years before joining his brother William in running Charles H. Greenthal and Co. -- a leading NYC real estate management firm. Once retired, he volunteered at Lenox Hill Hospital, read to the blind and doted on his wife of 59 years who he adored beyond words and was his absolute soulmate. A life-long Mets fan, he was a wonderful husband, father, grandfather, brother, son and friend. He is also survived by his mother Lillian West and adored brother William West, and precious step- grandchildren Anna and JT Schmitt and many loved nieces and nephews. We love you dad and will treasure your memory forever. Family will receive friends at Frank Campbell Funeral Chapel, 1076 Madison Avenue (81st Street) on Thursday, July 30, 6-8pm. Service will be at Frank Campbell on Friday, July 31 2015 at 1:30pm. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to Cornell University's Library, which he loved very much: Office of Alumni Affairs and Development, 130 E. Seneca St, Suite 400, Ithaca, NY 14850; cornell--fund@cornell.edu 1/3

FLORMAN--Selma, 99 years old, passed away on July 28, 2015. Beloved wife of the late Marvin George Florman. Mother of Barbara Becker and Lois Florman. Grandmother of Ricky and Brad Becker. Great-grandmother of Elizabeth, Ashley, Natalie, Olivia and Alyssa. Services Friday, 12 noon at Riverside Chapels of Great Neck. 1/3
